definitions.definition: Moral badness; wickedness ; malevolence ; the forces or behaviors that are the opposite or enemy of good .
examples: The evils of society include murder and theft.
Evil lacks spirituality, hence its need for mind control.

definitions.definition: Something which impairs the happiness of a being or deprives a being of any good; something which causes suffering of any kind to sentient beings; harm ; injury ; mischief .
A malady or disease ; especially in combination, as in king's evil , colt evil .

main_definition: Moral badness; wickedness ; malevolence ; the forces or behaviors that are the opposite or enemy of good .
secondary_definitions: Something which impairs the happiness of a being or deprives a being of any good; something which causes suffering of any kind to sentient beings; harm ; injury ; mischief .
( obsolete ) A malady or disease ; especially in combination, as in king's evil , colt evil .
